Question: who was ptolemy and what did he do
Answer:
answer: Ptolemy was an astronomer, geographer, and mathematician who lived in the 2nd century AD. He is best known for his work on astronomy, particularly his geocentric model of the solar system, which was the dominant model for over 1,400 years. He also wrote extensively on geography, and his work on this subject was also highly influential.
